title: GA4/GTM/OneTrust Blocker
description:
## Goal

**Context**

Google Tag Manager (GTM) by itself does NOT store any cookies on the browser. When tags on GTM are configured to send data to different platforms, such as Google Analytics, Linkedin, Google Ads, etc. - that's when cookies for the associated platform are stored on the browser. Each tag already contains a OneTrust condition, and will only fire if the user consents to the specific cookie category, such as functional, performance/analytics, or targeting.

On a related note, we've added the gtag.js code update for GA4's consent feature. This update will send a signal to the browser's dataLayer regarding the user's default consent status based on their country. For example, by default (no user interaction with the consent banner at this point), a user from a European country will NOT be tracked if they take no action (clicking "X" on the OneTrust banner).

The gtag.js code update enables the machine learning capabilities for GA4 to fill in the gap where users deny tracking (by default or by choice).

[More Details](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1i66ayUZTVuff41w6IKPVeSJ_pwL1nIX4pQZbF9Gpcro/edit#)

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When a user visits the site w*
* **Motivation**: *We want to load GTM at all times and prevent OneTrust from blocking *
* **Outcome**: *So we can ...*

#### Please provide more information related to this request

In attempt to prevent OT from blocking GTM we tried using `data-ot-ignore` and `optanon-category-C0001` from OneTrust's Docs. Both of these slowed down traffic to GA. A ticket was submitted to OneTrust support where they suggested that we focus on our script ordering since OneTRust loads after GTM in our codebase and that may potentially be preventing their auto blocking classes from working. In attempt to do we've tried:

- **Placing OneTrust above GTM in the head file**: no effect [[MR]](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/108574)
- **Using the addEventListener**: Using the addEventListener method to attach a load event listener to the OneTrust script, and then include the Google Tag Manager script inside the event listener function
this prevented GTM from loading at all [[MR]](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/merge_requests/1499)
- **Changing GTM’s Triggers to wait for OneTrust** [[MR]](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/118462)
This was suggested by [StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/75073704/onetrust-script-executing-after-google-tag-manager). By adding another trigger that onetrust fires when it's loaded and by adding an exception to existing pageview triggers to not fire if onetrust's consent cookies are missing or denied [[MR]](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/118462)
- **Increasing time interval on GTM attribute `wait_for_update`**:  no effect [[MR]](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/118797)
- **Loading OneTrust from GTM:** broke the functionality in the cookie banner and prevented user preferences from persisting [(shown here)](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/uploads/e582c4be996eae761a87d0ebb8fa65d7/video2798811226.mp4)
- **Removing GTM from the source of all cookies containing "gtm" individually in the OneTrust Dashboard**: _waiting for response from OT support_

**Does anyone in leadership have eyes on this project?**
- [x]  Yes `@laurenbarker`
- [ ]  No

## Page(s)
Which page(s) are involved in this request?

All pages, but let's start with about.gitlab.com subdomain for this issue.

## DCI
[DRI, Consulted, Informed](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/people-group/directly-responsible-individuals/#dri-consulted-informed-dci)

- [ ] DRI: @miraclebanks
- [ ] Consulted: @dennischarukulvanich

title: ENG: Refactor Software Faster Carousel Component
description:
[Software Faster page](https://about.gitlab.com/software-faster/)

The current carousel does not render all slide content on the page at once, but renders the content for the slide that's visible. This has made it difficult to render the video on slide two on page load, which is needed for Vimeo analytics to be pushed up to the dataLayer. 

Let's refactor the carousel component so that all slide content is rendered in the DOM, but is properly hidden until selected.

Related comment: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/marketing/digital-experience/buyer-experience/-/merge_requests/1611#note_1258247192

title: Ability to recognize logged in GitLab user
description:
## Goal
We would like to recognize when a user is logged into GitLab on the marketing site. 

The goal with this issue is to

1. Investigate how we could do this
1. Start a thread for each 'how' that gives a high-level overview, scope, & risks. We'll discuss as a team in each thread.
1. Chose a strategy. We'll determine next steps from there.

**We'll need to schedule these changes in the GDK to be before or after _March 7th_ because of the [Hard Production Change Lock](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/infrastructure/change-management/#production-change-lock-pcl) where the GDK will be updated to Ruby 3**

title: Updates to Search
description:
## Goal
We would like to update the Search. There were some features that were left off for MVC1, but we'd like to add them back to enhance the experience. 

#### Please provide more information related to this request
| Comment | In design | In production |
| ------ | ------ | ------ |
| 1. Update autocomplete to be more intelligent. It should not just serve up the suggested articles, but autocomplete/autocorrect what the user is typing. | ![image](/uploads/24c35df65235794f5306ad3231816b52/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/4de35ad8ad287ad402ab00ab3b2576dc/image.png) |
| 2. Filter by checkboxes (instead of radio buttons) | ![image](/uploads/0710617b711bd4193cf156ec0157692b/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/53d52b9dda147e7bfdfc292304b2a67a/image.png) |
| 3. Make the search results it’s own page so users can go back to their search after they’ve selected a result. Currently, if a user selects a result, they will have to go back to the page they were on before the search. |  | See [loom](https://www.loom.com/share/d2d25d7c14ca4e3c82c87e6998d428a3) |
| 4. Fix the search results so that they show the sources accurately (currently they all show as “About” even if it’s a blog page) | ![image](/uploads/e97898ac4ba11a1eacc303b9ec370e57/image.png) | ![image](/uploads/5298c8b8ba72a65747ce3fa1833f60e1/image.png) |

title: Netlify CMS authentication for only members of repository
description:
## Goal
For only members of a public GitLab repository to be able to access the Netlify CMS admin. 

For our use case, this means `about.gitlab.com/admin `

Currently anyone with a GitLab account can login to the admin. We'd like to restrict access to www-gitlab-com project members. 

Here's [the slack thread in #marketing](https://gitlab.slack.com/archives/C0AKZRSQ5/p1674306562076699) that spawned this issue.

Although any account can log in, their actions are still restricted based on their permissions. For example users could see "draft posts" which are just public MRs - already visible via gitlab.com's normal UI - but they wouldn't be able to merge without Maintainer permissions. **There is no current security risk**, just confusing behavior.

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *When anyone tries to login to the `about.gitlab.com/admin`, only those who are project members of [www-gitlab-com](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com) should be able to authenticate successfully.*
* **Motivation**: *We want to have the admin only available to GitLab team members.*
* **Outcome**: *So that non team-members don't have access to an "admin" site.*

#### Please provide more information related to this request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.

title: [ENG] Add sub copy to /devops-tools page
description:
## Goal
We would like to add text to the top of the /devops-tools page to make clear that these logos are in stack-rank or prioritized order based on strength or maturity in their category.  We will also link to the /competition from here

ex:
![CleanShot_2023-01-12_at_09.49.20](/uploads/2e970338bbbb3b5ee29bfa3abcef81c7/CleanShot_2023-01-12_at_09.49.20.jpg)

### Final Copy: 
1. H1: DevOps tools landscape (should be sentence case instead of title case as it currently is)
2. H5: As The DevSecOps Platform, GitLab’s focus is on providing a single application with best-in-class capabilities for the entire DevOps lifecycle.
3. Body-2: There are a ton of DevOps tools to choose from, many of which specialize in a few capabilities. We’ve ranked the tools for each stage of the DevOps lifecycle, starting with the most mature solutions. For more info on the maturity of GitLab and other key competitors, check out our DevOps maturity comparison chart.
4. Add a title to the table - H4: Top tools for each stage of the DevOps lifecycle

title: Enable anchor links as source for redirects
description:
## Goal
We would like to enable anchor links to be the `source` for redirects. 

We discovered this functionality didn't work when implementing redirects for the support pages [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/merge_requests/116174#note_1215292915). 

Another example is [this one](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/www-gitlab-com/-/blob/master/data/redirects.yml#L1302) which also doesn't work.

```yaml
- sources:
  - /handbook/finance/procurement/#prior-to-contacting-procurement
  - /handbook/finance/procurement/#prior-to-contacting-procurement/
  - /handbook/finance/procurement/prior-to-contacting-procurement/
  - /handbook/finance/procurement/prior-to-contacting-procurement
  target: /handbook/finance/procurement/vendor-selection-process/
  comp_op: '='
``` 

#### Jobs To Be Done
* **Situation**: *We wan't to enable anchor links to be the source for redirects*
* **Motivation**: *We want to redirect users to the correct place*
* **Outcome**: *So we can get them to the right place*

#### Please provide more information related to this request
Make sure the information you provide is relevant for your request. If unsure, please provide all the fields. Add/remove rows as needed.
